data.title: Barbara L. Steer
data.meta_description: She was born Sept. 21, 1920, in Rome, N.Y. She was a 1938 graduate of Sandusky High School, received her bachelor’s degree from the College of Wooster, and she earned her master’s degree from Bowling Green State University. She was employed by the Sandusky City Schools for 35 years, working at Barker and Monroe Schools. […]
data.text:
She was born Sept. 21, 1920, in Rome, N.Y. She was a 1938 graduate of Sandusky High School, received her bachelor’s degree from the College of Wooster, and she earned her master’s degree from Bowling Green State University. She was employed by the Sandusky City Schools for 35 years, working at Barker and Monroe Schools. She also helped the schools start all their libraries, the first was at Osborne School in 1966. She was a member of Grace Episcopal Church, Sandusky. Survivors include numerous great-nieces and nephews and great great-nieces and nephews. She was preceded in death by her parents Arthur & Lena (nee Barber) Steer; sister, Margaret Neiding; and brother, Kenneth Steer. Memorial Services will be held Tuesday, Aug. 21, 2007, at 10 a.m. in the Grace Episcopal Church Chapel, 315 Wayne Street, Sandusky. The Rev. Ernest G. Matijasic will officiate. Inurnment will be in Oakland Cemetery. Memorial contributions may be made to the Sandusky Library, 114 West Adams Street, Sandusky, Ohio 44870, or to the donor’s favorite charity. Arrangements by Pfeil Funeral Home, Sandusky Chapel, 617 Columbus Avenue, Sandusky.

Originally Published: August 19, 2007 at 10:14 a.m.
